name: Hilton Amsterdam

reviews.title: A great place to stay in Amsterdam
reviews.text: I just returned from a five night vacation in A'dam, and I loved this hotel. My room had an awesome view of the canal. The tram is right down the street and can take you anywhere in the city. The only negative part was the price of incidentals -- 100 euros for a week of internet access, six euros for a can of Pringles in the minibar, etc...the hotel seems to take advantage of the fact that it gets many business travelers with expense accounts, but it made it difficult for me traveling on my own dime. Nevertheless, it's a very luxurious place, with great service. I would definitely stay here again. I really enjoyed being in a more residential, quiet area of town, with easy access to the rest of the city. There are great restaurants and cafes nearby, and you are just minutes from the Vondelpark and the best art museums in the city.

As a Diamond card and platinum Hilton credit card holder I spent 8 months there. The quality of the accommodation and furnishings is very good but unfortunately the service is not. One day I experienced a number of problems in a row and although in themselves they were not large, the attitude of Management and response was appalling. In essence, they felt they had not caused any of the problems and where they felt they fell down (very late room service) they believed that if they provide a meal free of charge, this resolves the situation. Most service people recognise that the solution is not a free meal but steps to ensure this does not happen again. In any case, a free meal is of no use to a traveller who wishes to eat before 9.30pm and go to sleep after a long day that started at 5am but was served after that time. In addition, re. the non-functioning TV, I was first accused of not knowing how to switch it on (after 8 months of stay) and then of causing the problem in the first place. Suffice to say, great hotel if you don't mind being insulted or offended. Even after my last mail where I made the comment that this confirms that customers are never right and that the hotel believes they lie, I did not receive a reaction to this.
reviews.title: Management does not understand the ethos of customer service

reviews.text: This was the best Hilton we have ever stayed at. Honestly, we had enough points for 6 free nights, but we were treated like royalty. The room was spacious with a great view of a canal. The HHonors suite was fantastic - with a generous assortment of appetizers nightly. Sometimes, that was our dinner! The hot breakfast was great as well. True, its location is a bit out of the way, but walking one long block to the bus was no problem. It lent itself to a bit of peace and quiet. Service was terrific. It rained and our umbrella broke - they gave us a Hilton oversized umbrella to use. Though it did not have a shuttle to and from the airport, the multi-hotel shuttle stopped right there. It is more a business hotel than tourist hotel but we preferred it to the B&B's we have stayed in close to the "action."
reviews.title: Best Hilton Experience

reviews.text: Just stayed for 3 nights at the Hilton and it is very hard to pick faults with the place. The one and only fault, if you can call it that, is that the hotel is around 3 kilometres from the action. For me, being set in a quiet, upmarket suburb was a bonus and although you have to look for them, there are a few nice restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Hard to Fault

reviews.text: The staff were impeccably friendly and efficient and gave the impression that they actually were concerned that you had a pleasant stay. As a Hilton Honors member, I was disappointed that I didn't get an upgrade but I was promised one for next month when I return for a conference plus free breakfast which wasn't cheap.
reviews.title: Good Business Hotel

reviews.text: For the price of this hotel, I expected more. There's nothing terribly wrong with it, it's just a little faded and stuffy. Prices for food and amenities are fairly outrageous as it primarily caters to business travelers. For example 28 Euros for a club sandwich from room service is pretty steep.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: If you want a quiet neighborhood in Amsterdam though, this is the place. It's a bit of a walk even to the Museumplein/Van Gogh museum (about 15 minutes) but its a nice place to explore Amsterdam from as its well away from the ridiculous tourist stuff, the coffee shops/red light district. There is not too much around the hotel in terms of cafes or bars, so if you don't want to pay the hotel prices for food you have to plan well.
reviews.title: chris hutnan review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From my standpoint though the quiet location is the hotel's primary advantage. The grounds are beautiful and the staff was courteous but overall, the hotel just didn't feel welcoming.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, a little bit out of center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One other note, their ventilation system was really poor. We were on the non-smoking 5th floor but a smoking floor was directly under us. As a result we had a lot of smoke in our room every night.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - A bit removed from major tourist area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought the hotel was excellent. Myself (Chris Hutnan) and several of my friends attended. The hotel was a little outside the main part of town, but was a nice escape in the morning and evening.
reviews.title: Overall, very good experience

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton Amsterdam mid-May for four nights for a conference. The staff was exceptional - helpful, friendly, accommodating - everything one would expect. The room was large, comfortable, clean. Everything worked well, including the all-important water pressure in the shower. The bed was comfortable, the view of the canal from the back of the hotel was pleasant. Bring your own alarm clock - the clock display on the TV is small, and difficult to see from the bed.
reviews.title: Excellent business property

reviews.text: While out-of-the-way, it's a short walk to the #16 tram. This property is located in a residential area and it's considered "safe" by the locals to walk outside at all times of the day or night. Unless you're OK w/ paying €6.50 for a small bottle of Evian from the room, stop at a bodega before returning to the hotel. The breakfast buffet was good, but again, expensive at €25 (I think). Wireless internet in the hotel is fine for email, etc. but at €27 a day, I would have expected it to be rock-solid and it was not. Using Skype to call back to the US was spotty.
reviews.title: Expensive, and way out of town!!

reviews.text: I'd go back.
reviews.title: Top of the line but outside of town

reviews.text: We've never stayed at a Hilton before, but we managed to get a great rate by using a 'name your price' website... So we were looking forward to some major luxury at knock-down prices.
reviews.title: very nice stay

reviews.text: Well, the hotel was nice, but it didn't live up to the Hilton 'hype' for me. It was just a typical business hotel. And the prices of absolutely everything (apart from the room!) were prohibitive. They obviously make their money on the extras... For example, it was the equivalent of GBP 6.50 for a small bottle of Coke and about GBP 9.50 for a bottle of beer!!
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again!

reviews.text: We have just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel after being awarded it from a well known online hotel bidding Site ! At the price we paid we were very happy with the facilities though I have to admit I was hard pushed to see why this hotel was in the five star category as it was akin to the four star hotels that I would normally stay in .Sure you get a pillow menu and a soap menu (17.50 !!) but you do not get an in room iron ! I tend to take this for granted in most 4 star hotels so I was disappointed in this omission at 5 star level . The room however was very clean if a little plain , just a very standard hotel room , no wow factors.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel if you can get a good deal

reviews.text: As previously mentioned ,incidentals in the hotel are at 5 star prices, 32 Euro for Breakfast !! 20 Euro for a Marguerita Pizza . I cant comment on the presentation or quality .
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel
Not worth the price
reviews.text: Previous posters complain of the location of the hotel but because of the good tram communications I didnt have any complaints . The trams are very efficient and announce the next stop as it approches ,so its easy to get around . If you have limited time in the city I would advise using the tram as it is quite a walk from the hotel to the centre
tram 5 and 24 get off at stop Apollolaan
reviews.title: Super location & Staff

reviews.text: tram16 get of at stop Emmastraat
reviews.title: Warm staff - except for people at the reception

reviews.text: This is a great hotel with great service. I was a little worried about the location because of the other reviews. I found this area a fantastic refuge from Amsterdam. It is close to the Van Gogh museum and the high end fashion street. The hotel is well maintained and the people who work there were very professional. I am a Hilton diamond member and would return this hotel in the future.
reviews.title: Great stay...

reviews.text: I can't recommend this place strongly enough. Unusually for a chain hotel, it manages to be both intimate and characterful. The rooms are tastefully furnished, and manage to avoid feeling overly formulaic or inappropriately showy. The bar, and especially the outdoor terrace overlooking the canal, are appealing places to spend some time (although the prices, predictably, are prohibitively high). The care and attentivenesses of the staff (which I normally only notice if it's really good or bad) went way beyond what could reasonably be expected (in contrast to much of the rest of the city, where service is not uncommonly lamentable).
reviews.title: An excellent hotel for leisure or business

reviews.text: My only real concern about this hotel before staying there was the location. As it turned out, it's easily accessible via a number of tram routes (or, if you're feeling fit, walking from Amsterdam's compact centre). Indeed, its location on the fringe of the centre, in a very salubrious, quiet neighbourhood, added to the charm of the place.
reviews.title: The nicest hotel staff I have ever experienced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Assuming you can get a reasonable rate (I paid about $150 per night all inclusive through Priceline), this is an excellent choice of hotel.
reviews.title: lovely hotel,beautiful rooms,but a little out of the way for us!!

likes.liked: — john lennon stayed there with yoka and done there bed protest.so cool

reviews.text: I stayed here for three nights using my Hilton points. Because it was a reward stay, I expected the worst...but it was quite the opposite.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Not Bad Location

reviews.text: a really fine hotel.....the greatest mattress I have ever experienced and the linen was top of the line.....Tips....trams #5 and 24 get you to within 2 blocks but you cannot see the hotel until you walk the two blocks. Get off at Apollolaan. Plus, the tram may not stop unless you push the button ahead of time. My biggest complaint was the TV remote. It was difficult to make a channel selection. The second complaint was that a bottle of coke from the mini bar was$11.
reviews.title: very pleasant

reviews.text: Stayed at this property for 2 nights and used hilton hhonors points. I checked in at around 1pm and was told the only room available was one with two twin beds, right next to the elevator with a view of the lovely parking lot. My profile clearly states I prefer a King bed away from the elevator. I was so tired at the time I decided to just accept the room because the clerk was unsure as to when another room would become available. When I entered the room I noticed wall paper peeling off the walls, somewhat dirty carpet and just an overall dingy feel. I was so glad that I wasn't actually paying for this crap. I decided to check out the executive lounge and on my way up I met two guests who had checked in a few hours before. They were not hilton hhonors members and they booked their room on priceline. Surprisingly they were given a junior suite facing the canal. I complained to the front desk and was given a multitude of ludicrious excuses as to why I wasn't upgraded. I suspect the gentleman who checked me in had lied about which rooms were available. At this property as a Diamond member I was offered the worst available room instead of the best available room.
reviews.title: Diamond members treated poorly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On to the good part. The executive lounge was truly excellent. The breakfast consisted of eggs, meats, cereals, fruits, nuts and pastries. There were always drinks and snacks available all day. At night they served sushi, egg rolls, and french pastries. The staff was very attentive, always asking if I needed anything. All and all it made up for the crappy room.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay at the Amsterdam Hilton

likes.liked: — Quiet and we had a beautiful view of the Canal.
likes.disliked: — Had to take tram into city but not a big problem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One other bad part to the hotel is the location. It's very far from the city centre and even farther from the central station. Besides the restaurant in the hotel there are no places to eat in the area. There are numerous trams about a block from the hotel but if you plan on walking to the sites, it's quite a hike.
reviews.title: The absolute best!

likes.liked: — Too many plusses to name just one - staff, room, location, view, luxury, etc. etc.
likes.disliked: — Sorry - I can't come up with one bad thing !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On to the fitness facility. It was absolutely great for a hotel gym. Although the moment i walked into the facility I was asked to remove my shoes. They do not permit outside shoes in the fitness area. What's especially perplexing about this is that the staff is so concerned about dirt on the floor but in the area around the equipment there was no anti-bacterial spray . In other words they don't care if someone sweats all over the equipment but they are terrified if by chance a speck of dirt is found on one of the treadmills or on the floor.
reviews.title: Fabulous breakfast and toiletries, tea!
Definitley a 5-star Hilton!
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton Amsterdam for a weekend with my boyfriend.

My first impression: It took some time to get to the hotel from central station. But we were outweighted with our fabulous stay. As we arrived, the very friendly staff helped us with our check-in and we got our keys for a beautiful deluxe-room with a lovely view over the lake and amsterdam.
reviews.title: To Far Out

reviews.text: The bed was very soft what I found very relaxing. There's a desk in the deluxe-rooms as well as two chairs and a small board. The bathroom was very clean and well designed.
reviews.title: Best Hilton I've stayed in!

reviews.text: Breakfast at the restaurant was very variegated. The staff here was excellent as well!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Hilton Amsterdam which we booked through priceline and got a good rate. The hotel is up to date - room was nice, lobby and view were nice. The staff were friendly and helpful. We did not use any of the amenities or restaurants at the hotel.
reviews.title: Decent

likes.liked: — In a quiet, safe neighborhood; good TV channels
likes.disliked: — About a 40 minute walk to most attractions

reviews.text: The hotel is about a ten minute walk from the tram stop in a nice quiet neighborhood. Many of the city's attractions are a long walk from the Hilton but at the rate we got, we can't complain.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If in Amsterdam again, the Hilton would be an option but we might consider hotels closer to town depending on the price.
reviews.title: A Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel and even though we only stayed for a night, we definitely enjoyed our stay and would have stayed longer if we had time.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel

likes.disliked: — Probably on the high end from a rate perspective

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was extremely helpful and very knowledgable of the area. They even let us check in early and prepared our room while we waited in the grand lobby which looked like something you would see in a movie with Roman or Greek theme with tall marble beams and "ceasar's castle-like" furnitures.
reviews.title: Pack your credit card!
What a great Hilton!
reviews.text: Wow this is a wonderful hilton property. I have stayed at tons of hiltons and i am a diamond member. This is one of the nicest hotels i have ever stayed in. The rooms were new and fabulous, the view of the canal breathtaking. The executive level club room was great if you get a room on that level. THe area is quiet and pretty and residential, but a 10 minute walk to the museums. I loved it there!

reviews.title: Couldn't have been better...
reviews.text: I'd decided to book a few well deserved few days of rest in Amsterdam (one of my favourite cities) and wanted what seemed to be impossible - a nice hotel, that wouldn't break the bank. I managed to score a great deal for this hotel on Priceline and accepted it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of course, being a Priceline deal I thought that I was going to be stuck in one of the hotels worst rooms (which can often happen), but either way was willing to accept whatever happened for the price I had paid.
reviews.title: Peaceful Hilton

likes.disliked: — Not being able to walk to the centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived, warm and sweaty after the trip from Schiphol via Centraal Station and the 16 tram and was greated by really friendly door staff and reception, who (unlike in other hotels) engaged in conversation and were very clear about what the hotel offered and the range of services. At no time was I treated any differently than a full rate paying guest and, in fact, I was treated better than I have been in many 5* hotels. I was asked if I would prefer a room with a view (obviously I would, but again its nice to be ask - not just assigned). I was given a room (with a gorgeous view over the canal/marina) on the 4th floor which was prefect. The decor was modern, the bed comfortable and the bathroom spotless and well stocked with towels and toiletries. The only complaint I could muster was that the desk chair wasn't great for sitting on for prolonged periods.
reviews.title: Wonderful Weekend

reviews.text: Staff were always attentive, yet discreet. You would get greeted or asked how your day/afternoon/evening went, yet never felt like it was forced or heavy handed. Reception staff also functioned in the same professional and slick manner.
reviews.title: Picturesque: A Great Starting Point for Amsterdam

likes.disliked: — Difficult to find late-night eating/drinking in hotel or nearby

reviews.text: What a wonderful hotel. Every element about our stay at the Amsterdam Hilton was excellent. Got a fantastic rate on a 3rd party website. We were a party of 3, and even though the hotel for the most part is a two to a room property, they gladly acommodated our third person at no cost. We checked in at 9AM, and were greeted by wonderful, friendly, polite and effecient staff. Even though check in was not until the afternoon, they managed to have our room ready by 9:45! Thank you! The room was big enough with a fantastic bed. Bathroom was huge and totally comfortable. The shower was incredible. There could be a complaint made about the location. You are not in central Amsterdam, however...........the trams which are only a five minute walk to, put you in Central Amsterdam in around 10-15 minutes. The hotel is located in a quiet and charming area that actually makes you glad you stayed there. There are many very nice local restaurants within walking distance if you choose not to head to central Amsterdam. This is a great hotel with staff who remind you of what people used to be like when customer service was the most important thing. Stay here with complete and utter confidence!!
reviews.title: A Wonderful Option within a short distance of Central Amsterdam

likes.disliked: — Might be unwise for those who need to be right in Central Amsterdam

reviews.text: We have returned from our month in Europe and had stayed 3-nights in the Hilton Amsterdam. We took two rooms which we booked thru priceline ($150 US per night, per room). The hotel was as expected for a high 4-star, low 5-star hotel. Since we booked thru priceline we could not get the breakfast added afterwards - that was a bummer since we then had to get going elsewhere, the breakfast we found expensive at 25 euros per person. The accommodation was terrific for the price and better than a standard hilton, but not quite the 5-star of a Four Season or Fairmount.
reviews.title: Would stay there again!!

likes.disliked: — Location was slightly out of the way from the central tourist attractions and shopping

reviews.title: Short Celebration break
reviews.text: When we had initially arrived in Amsterdam, I was expecting to take a taxi to the hotel from the train station but was pleasantly surprised that travelling with our luggage in tow on the tram system was fine. The location was only slightly out of the way since it was our first time in Amsterdam and all the sights were central. We always started our day with a nice brisk scenic walk (about a large block) to the tram.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only put-off was when we asked about bike rentals and was told by the staff it was not available for discounted rooms, even though I was willing to play for the rental and the bikes were sitting outside. I was told that they have limited numbers and were not for the discounted rooms! They did give us a brochure for a local bike rental company away from the hotel that was not convenient for us at the time.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

likes.disliked: — Exterior of hotel is a time trip to the 1970s.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we would have not problems staying there again at the right price!
reviews.title: Beautiful Amsterdam Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for approx. $179 USD/night on hotwire. We were not disappointed. From the moment we checked in to the time we left, everyone was polite, friendly, welcoming (even when we came in at 3 a.m. after a night on the town) and the service was flawless. I truly cannot say enough nice things about this hotel. Believe the "Best Luxury Amsterdam" award given by TripAdvisor! I would gladly stay here again in a heartbeat, and so would my partner!
reviews.title: Best way to start our honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one drawback is that the hotel is slightly outside the main tourist attractions, but is easily accessible via either Tram 5/24 or Tram 16. The neighborhood is arguably the nicest in Amsterdam (very tony houses along a wide canal), and the location is actually very close to the airport (if you are taking an airport-hotel shuttle, you will likely be the first dropped off from the airport and the last picked up before the airport).
reviews.title: Love The View

likes.disliked: — A bit far from the party scene...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Property is located out of the mainstream Red Light District in a charming tree lined neighborhood. We attempted getting there by train, but were unable to communicate well enough to make it all the way. We finally just got off and grabbed a taxi, as we had been traveling for quite a while....We MAY have had better luck just getting on the tram.
reviews.title: Swanky Digs

reviews.text: If you choose this one over the airport Hilton, I would plan ahead a bit better than we did! Perhaps you could contact the hotel and find out which train or tram to take. Definitely get written directions and an address. When we got it in the taxi, our driver did not seem to know where it was. May have been a communication problem.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

likes.disliked: — Snacks and drinks a bit on the pricey side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room overlooked the canal and some very nice homes were across from us. We had a very large picture window and two windows on either end swung out to let a breeze in. Truly I could have sat there for hours just enjoying the view and gorgeous mahogany boats along the canal. Otherwise, the room was very comfortable. They have bicycles for you to use for no charge. The pool looks over the canal, though it was a bit chilly for us. They have a nice outdoor dining area on the canal.
reviews.title: Loved it all

reviews.text: Fantastic hotel, staff, breakfast and bar!
reviews.title: Fab!!

likes.liked: — Attentive staff, cleanliness and such a lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was fab, clean, large and really comfortable.
reviews.title: smart service

reviews.text: Sat on the terrace drinking and reading the paper and just chilling out, that was wonderful. Staff really attentive, concierge so knowledgeable, breakfast was superb.
reviews.title: One of the best Hiltons but pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Property

reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights from july 29th, All that everyone else writes is true, the rooms are tidy and clean, the staff service levels are excellent, nothing is too much trouble, located out of town a short distance. The trams into town are caught either just along Emmastraat (no 16) or at the far end of Emmastraat (no2), next to an entrance to Vondelpark. along the way are a couple of restaurants and a minimarket. a fantastic way to spend a 'sundowner' on a warm summers evening is on the canalside terrace, the sun is 'just right'. There is a kettle in the room but only coffe is supplied, take your own tea bags! there is room in the in room fridge minibar for a small carton of milk. The John Lennon suite is on the 7th floor at the front left hand end of the hotel. I would go back there in an instant.
reviews.title: Great Staff, Small Room

likes.disliked: — Location, a little far away from the center

description: Welcome to Hilton Amsterdam hotel. Famous for John Lennon and Yoko Ono's 1969 bed-in, the Hilton Amsterdam hotel is a short walk from the Van Gogh Museum and Amsterdam attractions. This canal-side hotel has an award-winning Italian restaurant and is 15 minutes from Schiphol Airport. Do business in the Executive Lounge or unwind in the health club.
